prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] With the new coordinate system in place, we will proceed to draw the 2D sketch for the first part. The sketch lies on a plane defined by the coordinate system. This sketch has one face (face\\_1) with the following loop (loop\\_1): loop\\_1: * line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.5785, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point = [0.5785, 0.0], End Point = [0.5785, 0.75] * line\\_3: Start Point = [0.5785, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] * line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Each sketch can contain multiple faces, and loops in a face must be closed. Our sketch has one face with one closed loop. There are 4 lines in our loop, no circles or arcs. Next, we'll transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles and a translation vector. In our case, the euler angles and translation vector come from the part's coordinate\\_system properties. This creates a 3D sketch in the same position and orientation as if it were physically rotated and translated. Finally, we are ready to extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The sketch will be extruded based on the properties provided. Here are the extrusion properties: Extrusion: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.2163 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 (no extrusion in this direction) * sketch\\_scale: 0.75 * operation: "NewBodyFeatureOperation" (add material to the CAD assembly) The resulting CAD part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with the following dimensions: Dimensions: * length: 0.75 * width: 0.75 * height: 0.2163 Pass on these instructions to the junior CAD engineer, ensuring that they understand the shape being constructed and how to proceed with the detailed step-by-step instructions to build each part.</description>
